adjective.description: Designating a stage of the Jurassic between the Oxfordian in the Upper Jurassic and the Bathonian in the Middle Jurassic; of or relating to this stage, or to the period of time during which its rocks were deposited.

noun.description: Chiefly with the. The Callovian stage or period.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in Thomas Wright. From French callovien (A. D'Orbigny, 1850 or earlier) from post-classical Latin Calloviensis; compare -ian.
